    • Method Detail

      • createTransformationMatrix

        public static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Matrix4f createTransformationMatrix(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f translation,
                                                                        float rx,
                                                                        float ry,
                                                                        float rz,
                                                                        float scale)
        Create the transformation matrix, it enable us to use the same model to render different instance in different places in the world
        Parameters:
        translation - position of the object in the world
        rx - rotation of the object around the x-axis
        ry - rotation of the object around the y-axis
        rz - rotation of the object around the z-axis
        scale - scale of the object
        Returns:
        The transformation matrix used to transform the object's local coordinates to coordinates in the world

                                                                           float scale)
        Create the transformation matrix, it enable us to use the same model to render different instance in different places in the world
        Parameters:

        rx - rotation of the object around the x-axis
        ry - rotation of the object around the y-axis
        rz - rotation of the object around the z-axis
        scale - scale of the object
        Returns:
        The transformation matrix used to transform the object's local coordinates to coordinates in the world

      • createViewMatrix

        public static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Matrix4f createViewMatrix(Camera camera)
        Create the view matrix, which is used to transform coordinates from absolute world space to camera space
        Parameters:
        camera - the camera used for rendering
        Returns:
        The view matrix used to transform the object's world coordinates to coordinates in the camera space

      • loopVector

        public static org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f loopVector(org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f input,
                                                        org.lwjgl.util.vector.Vector3f size)
        Make the input vector coordinates loop around the size vector it's effectively a modulus
        Parameters:
        input - the input vector to loop around
        size - vector representing the upper limit of each coordinates
        Returns:
        a looped 3D Vector with it's input included in [0; size]
